name: Wallkit/Wallkit.js
Wallkit
description: Base Class.

name: constructor
description: Wallkit Base Class Constructor.

name: initialized
description: Shows Wallkit has initialized.

name: log
description: Method showing value with Wallkit LOG in console,  if Config.debug enabled.
examples: Wallkit.log('Some data'); // Wallkit LOG: Some data

params.name: log
params.description: string value to show in console

name: init
description: Method inits Wallkit.

name: user
description: User information.

name: token
description: Token.

name: resource
description: Resource

name: client
description: Client instance to Manipulate with API.

name: config
description: Wallkit Config instance.

name: listener
description: Method handle Event Listeners callback.

name: initListener
description: Method init Event Listeners for messages.

name: setToken
description: Method sets token.

name: getToken
description: Returns token object, where value is token.

name: isAuthenticated
description: Method checks is user authenticated.
examples: Wallkit.isAuthenticated();

name: checkAuth
description: Method init user by inited token.

name: registration
description: Method register user in Wallkit. After success authorization, method initializes token & user instances. Returns Promise with received user object.
examples: Wallkit.signUp();

name: login
description: Method loging user in Wallkit. After success authorization, method initializes token & user instances. Returns Promise with received user object.

name: logout
description: Method logout user from Wallkit. After success response, method removes token & user instances.  Removes cookies & localstorage datas.

name: getUser
description: Method inits custom event
examples: new this.CustomEvent(eventName + ":success", { bubbles: false, cancelable: false, detail: data })

name: authUserByToken
description: Method authenticate user by provided token and auth method type(authorizationUser/registrationUser).

name: getResource
description: Gets Wallkit's client resource such as `public_key`, `origin`, `payments_in_live_mode`, `stripe_public_key`.

name: getResources
description: Returns promise with resources object which includes resources array.

name: passwordReset
description: Reset password by user email.

name: getSubscriptions
description: Get available subscription for payment

name: refreshToken
description: request authorization/refresh

name: Wallkit/WallkitClient.js
WallkitClient
description: Class to manipulate with Wallkit API.

name: constructor
description: Wallkit Client constructor. Accepts nothing.

name: token
description: Gets token.

name: resource
description: Gets Wallkit Config resource.

name: host
description: Gets Wallkit Host based on provided config.

name: get
description:
Method makes GET request to manipulate with Wallkit API.
API Documentation at https://wallkit.net/docs

name: post
description:
Method makes POST request to manipulate with Wallkit API.
API Documentation at https://wallkit.net/docs

name: nativePost
description:
Method makes native-post request to manipulate with Wallkit API.
API Documentation at https://wallkit.net/docs

name: postForm
description:
Method makes Post request with Form Data.
API Documentation at https://wallkit.net/docs

name: put
description:
Method makes PUT request to manipulate with Wallkit API.
API Documentation at https://wallkit.net/docs

name: del
description:
Method makes DELETE request to manipulate with Wallkit API.
API Documentation at https://wallkit.net/docs

name: makeNativeRequest
description: Method wrapper for request to manipulate with Wallkit API.

name: makeRequest
description: Method wrapper for request to manipulate with Wallkit API.

name: Wallkit/WallkitResource.js
WallkitResource
description: Class to manipulate with Resources.

name: constructor
description: Constructor for WallkitResource class.

name: serialize
description: Serialize resource instance and insert it in localstorage
examples: WallkitResource.serialize();

name: deserialize
description: Deserialize user from localStorage and creates instance of {@link WallkitResource}
examples: WallkitResource.deserialize();

name: Wallkit/WallkitToken.js
WallkitToken
description: Class to manipulate with Tokens.

name: constructor
description: Constructor for WallkitToken Class.

name: serialize
description: Serialize token instance and insert it in localstorage
examples: WallkitToken.serialize();

name: deserialize
description: Deserialize token from localStorage and creates instance of {@link WallkitToken}
examples: WallkitToken.deserialize();

name: Wallkit/WallkitUser.js
WallkitUser
description: Class to manipulate with User.

name: constructor
description: Constructor for WallkitUser class.
examples:
let user = new WallkitUser({
  active: true,
   can_own_teams: true,
   city: "Odessa",
   company: "Grandiz",
   confirm: true,
   country: "American Samoa",
   created_at: "2015-12-16 12:33:18",
   email: "dev@gwallkit.net",
   ...
})

name: serialize
description: Serialize user instance and insert it in localstorage
examples: WallkitUser.serialize();

name: isConfirmed
description: Method checks is user passed confirmation.
examples: WallkitUser.isConfirmed();

name: plans
description: Method gets user's plans list.
examples: WallkitUser.plans();

name: hasPlan
description: Method checks if User has provided plan.

name: deserialize
description: Deserialize user from localStorage and creates instance of {@link WallkitUser}
examples: WallkitToken.deserialize();

name: Wallkit/utils/Events.js

content:
![logo](https://wallkit.net/wallkit/images/wallkit-logo.svg "Wallkit")

# Usage

 - [Installation](#installation)
 - [Initialization](#initialization)
 - [What next?](#what-next-)
 
 
## Installation

1. Download Wallkit SDK from https://wallkit.net/

2. Include Wallkit SDK To Website/App  

    - As HTML 
    ```html
    <script src="wallkit.umd.min.js"></script>
    ```
    
    - As UMD
    ```javascript
    require('wallkit.umd.min.js');
    ```
    
    - As ES module
    ```javascript
    import Wallkit from 'wallkit.esm.min.js';
    ```

## Initialization

 To start using Wallkit SDK, use [Wallkit.init()](class/Wallkit/Wallkit.js~Wallkit.html#instance-method-init) method, with [config](./manual/Config.html).
 
 ```js
// Example
Wallkit.init({
    resource: "3535"
});
```

## What next?

As you see it is really easy to integrate Wallkit SDK into your website or app. So here are your next steps:

 - Go to [Documentation](./manual/Methods.html) or [Reference](identifiers.html) to learn more about Wallkit SDK and how to use it.
 - If you have questions about Wallkit SDK don't hesitate to ask them to our [Wallkit Team.](http://wallkit.net)
name: ./manual/Index.md

content:
{
  "name": "wallkit-js-sdk",
  "version": "0.0.35",
  "description": "Wallkit",
  "main": "dist/wallkit.umd.min.js",
  "private": true,
  "directories": {
    "example": "examples"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1",
    "server": "webpack-dev-server --content-base public/",
    "watch": "webpack --env.watch --progress --config ./configs/webpack.library.config.js && webpack --env.watch --progress --config ./configs/webpack.esm.config.js",
    "build": "webpack --env --config ./configs/webpack.library.config.js && webpack --env --config ./configs/webpack.esm.config.js",
    "doc": "./node_modules/.bin/esdoc"
  },
  "files": [
    "dist",
    "src",
    ".babelrc"
  ],
  "author": "Wallkit",
  "license": "UNLICENSED",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.4.0",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties": "^7.4.0",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-export-default-from": "^7.2.0",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread": "^7.4.0",
    "@purtuga/esm-webpack-plugin": "^1.0.1",
    "babel-loader": "^8.0.5",
    "babel-preset-es2015": "^6.24.1",
    "babel-preset-stage-0": "^6.22.0",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-custom-theme": "^1.4.2",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-inject-style-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-publish-html-plugin": "^1.1.2",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "jquery": "^3.2.0",
    "jsdoc": "^3.4.0",
    "lodash": "^4.17.4",
    "uglify-js": "^3.5.2",
    "validate.js": "^0.11.1",
    "webpack": "^4.29.6",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.3.0",
    "webpack-dev-server": "^2.4.2",
    "whatwg-fetch": "^2.0.3"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@babel/polyfill": "^7.4.0",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.4.2",
    "bluebird": "^3.5.0",
    "es6-promise": "^4.1.1"
  }
}

# Usage

 - [Installation](#installation)
 - [Initialization](#initialization)
 - [What next?](#what-next-)
 
 
## Installation

1. Download Wallkit SDK from https://wallkit.net/

2. Include Wallkit SDK To Website/App  

    - As HTML 
    ```html
    <script src="wallkit.umd.min.js"></script>
    ```
    
    - As UMD
    ```javascript
    require('wallkit.umd.min.js');
    ```
    
    - As ES module
    ```javascript
    import Wallkit from 'wallkit.esm.min.js';
    ```

## Initialization

 To start using Wallkit SDK, use [Wallkit.init()](class/Wallkit/Wallkit.js~Wallkit.html#instance-method-init) method, with [config](./manual/Config.html).
 

## What next?

As you see it is really easy to integrate Wallkit SDK into your website or app. So here are your next steps:

 - [Initialization](#initialization)
 - [What next?](#what-next-)

1. Download Wallkit SDK from https://wallkit.net/

2. Include Wallkit SDK To Website/App

name: ./manual/API.md
content:
# API
  
  You can find API Documentation and try it out at [Wallkit API Documentation](http://wallkit.net/docs).

name: ./manual/Methods.md
./manual/Config.md
content: # Config **Wallkit SDK config.**In additional changes, Wallkit Team will notify you.Name              | Required | Default | Description                                  | Example----------------- | -------- | ------- | -------------------------------------------- | ---------api_url           | true     | -       | API host                                     | api.wallkit.netresource          | true     | -       | Public key from http://wallkit.net/resources | 35D02754-9A51-2C23-A5F7-79970C4debug             | false    | true    | Debug mode                                   | false
